title: The One Where Ross and Rachel Take A Break

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is taking a jar of olives out of the
fridge.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Hey, how much will you give me to eat this whole jar of olives?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I won’t give you anything, but you’ll owe me 2.95.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Done.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey. I need an atlas! I need an atlas!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why? (in a motherlike tone) Do you have a report due?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I have a date with this diplomat I met while I was giving free massages outside the UN and, I don’t know where his country is.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, let’s start with the free messages outside the UN.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh!! That’s my new thing. I figure bodies at peace, make peace.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow! You might just get the first Nobel prize in rubbing. So what country is this guy from?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ick-neck-tree-anis..... There’s a ‘g’ in there.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Where’s that?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: In your atlas!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don’t have an atlas.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, but wait I do have a globe.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hold on.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So Pheebs what’s this guy like?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Umm, well he’s very dashing, y'know, and umm, very, very sophisticated, and he doesn’t speak any English, but according to his translator, he totally gets me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ‘Kay, here you go. (Hands her this tiny little globe.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What is this?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It’s a globe and, a pencil sharpener.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey, does anybody need anything copied? I’m going down to the Xerox place.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, no thanks.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay listen, just give me anything I can make two of.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, if you don’t have anything to copy, why are you going down there?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, are you just going down there to gawk at that hot girl with the belly button ring again?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah! You wanna come?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is taking a jar of olives out of the
fridge.]

events.event_description: Joey asks Monica how much she will pay him to eat a jar of olives.
Monica responds that Joey owes her $2.95 for eating the olives.
Joey agrees to pay Monica $2.95 to eat the olives.
Phoebe enters the scene and asks for an atlas to locate a country for her date.
Monica questions Phoebe about her report, implying she is giving massages outside the UN.
Phoebe describes her date with a diplomat and her difficulty locating his country.
Monica offers Phoebe a globe and a pencil sharpener to help locate the country.
Chandler enters and offers to copy documents at the Xerox place, asking for anything he can duplicate.
Chandler questions Monica about why he is going to the Xerox place if he has nothing to copy.
Joey teases Chandler about going to gawk at a girl with a belly button ring, and Chandler invites Joey to come along.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Xerox place, Chandler and Joey are waiting in line.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Come on Chloe! Finish up with your customer first. Come on Chloe! Come on Chloe!!

dialogue.speaker: ISSAC
dialogue.text: (to Chandler and Joey) Can I help you?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Uh-oh.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh, y'know what, we’re having second thoughts about our copying needs. And we’ll need a little more time to think about it.

dialogue.speaker: ISSAC
dialogue.text: Chloe, switch with me, there’s some guys here that got a crush on you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Joey) Okay, that hurt us.

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Hi guys. I haven’t seen you since this morning.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well ah, ........y'know.

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Hey, what are you guys doing tomorrow night?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Both of us? (points to Chandler and himself)

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Maybe. Does that scare ya?

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Relax. It’s just Issac’s D.J.-ing at the Philly. You should come.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: We’ll be there.

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Great. I’ll ah, see ya then.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right, rock on. (Does the ‘Hang 10’ sign, then hides his face in shame.)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Xerox place, Chandler and Joey are waiting in line.]

events.event_description: Chandler urges Chloe to finish with her customer first.
Issac asks Chandler and Joey if he can help them.
Chandler comments with 'Uh-oh' upon Issac's question.
Joey tells Chandler that they are having second thoughts about their copying needs and need more time.
Issac suggests Chloe switch with him because some guys have a crush on her.
Chloe greets Chandler and Joey, mentioning she hasn't seen them since this morning.
Chloe asks Chandler and Joey if they are doing anything tomorrow night.
Joey confirms they will be at Issac's DJ event at the Philly.
Chloe agrees to see Chandler and Joey then.
Chandler makes a 'rock on' gesture and hides his face in shame.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: A Street, Phoebe is walking along with the diplomat (Sergei) and his translator
(Mischa).]

dialogue.speaker: SERGEI
dialogue.text: (something in Russian or Polish)

dialogue.speaker: MISCHA
dialogue.text: He’s says, ‘Walking with you makes this strange city, feel like home.’

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Me too. Although this city is my home, so. So that’s dumb what I said, don’t tell him I said that. Umm, you make something up. (Mischa does so and Sergei kisses her hand.) Nice, (to Mischa) thank you. This is me. Here.

dialogue.speaker: MISCHA
dialogue.text: (leaning in) Your eyes are very pretty.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Mischa) Thank you, very much! Oh! (to Sergei) Thank you!

dialogue.speaker: MISCHA
dialogue.text: (leaning in) He would like to kiss you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Mischa) Okay, y'know what, you don’t have to do that now. (Mischa translates that to Sergei) No-no-no-no!! Not him, you don’t! (Mischa tells Sergei he can proceed and steps away) Well the moment’s over.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: MISCHA
dialogue.text: Oy!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: A Street, Phoebe is walking along with the diplomat (Sergei) and his translator
(Mischa).]

events.event_description: Sergei speaks in Russian or Polish to Phoebe and Mischa.
Mischa translates Sergei’s words to Phoebe, saying, 'Walking with you makes this strange city feel like home.'
Phoebe responds to Mischa, saying she agrees and asks him to make something up, then Mischa does so.
Sergei kisses Mischa's hand after Mischa makes up a compliment.
Mischa comments on Phoebe's eyes, leaning in towards her.
Phoebe thanks Mischa and Sergei for their compliments.
Mischa suggests that Sergei would like to kiss Phoebe, leaning in towards her.
Phoebe tells Mischa that he doesn’t have to facilitate the kiss now, indicating the moment is over.
Mischa translates Phoebe's statement to Sergei, telling him he can proceed with the kiss.
Mischa steps away from Sergei and Phoebe, signaling the end of the moment.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is showing Monica where Sergei’s country is.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (pointing to the globe) See there it is right there.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow! It’s small.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah. But Sergei said it took the Germans six weeks to get all the way across it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So you had fun, huh?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah. Except for, y'know when you’re on a date and you’re getting along really great but the guy’s translator keeps getting in the way.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE AND MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What is ah, Rach in her room?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh no, she’s still at work, but she told me to tell you to call her.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh what?! Is she gonna cancel on me again?! How can she do this? Doesn’t she know it’s our anniversary?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right ah, Ross, this is the extent of my knowledge on the subject. (holds up a notepad) Call Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What’s that on the bottom?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh that’s my doodle of a ladybug, with a top hat. (to Phoebe) She’s fancy.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (answering her phone at work) Hello.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, honey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, hi.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, what’s going on?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, there was a disaster in shipping and I’ve got to get this order in. Honey, I’m so sorry, but it looks like I’m gonna be here all night.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What, do you, well umm, oh how about I come up there?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No-no-no, no, honey please, I’ve got, I’ve just have so much to deal with.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Anyway, I’m going out with Sergei again tonight, and um, could you come and be the translator’s date? So that when we, it’s time for our alone time, you two could split off. Y'know, he’s really, he’s kinda cute.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, well kinda cute, like really kinda cute, or kinda cute like your friend Spackel Back Larry?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey, don’t call him that! His name is Spackel Back Harry!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is showing Monica where Sergei’s country is.]

events.event_description: Phoebe points to a location on the globe, indicating Sergei's country.
Monica comments on the size of Sergei's country.
Phoebe mentions that Sergei said it took Germans six weeks to cross Sergei's country.
Ross enters the scene and asks about Rachel.
Monica informs Ross that Rachel is still at work and asks him to call her.
Ross expresses frustration about Rachel possibly canceling their anniversary plans.
Monica shows Ross a notepad with a doodle of a ladybug with a top hat, joking about it being her.
Rachel answers her phone at work and greets Ross.
Rachel informs Ross that there was a shipping disaster and she must work late.
Phoebe asks Monica to be Sergei's translator's date for her upcoming outing with Sergei.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are sitting on the big couch.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, y'know what, maybe we should get going. I mean what time did Chloe say we should be there?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What time is it now?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah all right, so we’ll hang out.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah. Hey, remember when she brought up that thing about the three of us?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes. Vividly.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: She was kidding about that right?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, I-I-I think so. (Pauses and thinks about it for a second) Yeah, I-I think so...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: God, that would be weird it that situation presented itself tonight, huh?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah. Yeah, I mean what, what would we do?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Dude, I don’t know.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: She was kidding.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: She was.... But y'know what, just in case, maybe we should come up with a set of ground rules.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, for sure. Okay. Probably want the first thing to be, never open your eyes. Y'know, because you don’t want to be doing something and then look up and see something you don’t want to be seeing.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah. Good call, nice one. Hold it!! Hold it! What if me eyes are closed, and, and my hand is out there.... (holds his arm out and pretends to grab something with his hand.)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ah!! Okay! Eyes open at all times! Oh, hey, how do we decide where we... (clears throat) y'know each would, (clears throat again) y'know (pause) be?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Right. Right. Well ah, y'know we could flip for it.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, I guess, but what’s like heads and what’s tails?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well it you don’t know that, then I don’t want to do this with you.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are sitting on the big couch.]

events.event_description: Chandler suggests they should leave because they are unsure of the time they need to be somewhere.
Joey confirms that Chloe said they should be there at 10:30.
Chandler asks Joey what time it is now.
Joey responds that it is 4:30.
Chandler decides to hang out since the current time is much earlier than the scheduled time.
Joey recalls Chloe mentioning a 'thing about the three of us' and asks if she was kidding.
Chandler agrees that Chloe was joking about the three of them and reflects on the situation.
Joey comments that it would be weird if such a situation occurred tonight.
Chandler and Joey discuss the possibility of Chloe's joke becoming a real situation and what they would do.
Chandler proposes creating ground rules for such a situation, including never opening their eyes.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Rachel’s office, Rachel and a co-worker (Sophie) are dealing with the
crisis.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on the phone) No, no, no, I’m looking at a purchase order right here and it clearly states that we ordered the Rivera bikini in a variety of sizes and colours. And.... (listens) What does it matter, what I’m wearing?! Can I please speak to your supervisor? (listens) Thank you. (to Sophie) We’re holding.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering, carrying a basket) Hi!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (startled) Oh!! My God, what are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well you said you couldn’t go out so.... (pulls the cover off of the basket)

dialogue.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: You brought a picnic, oh, what a boyfriend. That’s it, on Monday I start wearing make-up.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross honey, this is very nice, but, but I-I got a crisis.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, but I got cous-cous!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Honey, honey, I’m sorry, I know it’s our anniversary but I told you on the phone I don’t have time to stop.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, you don’t have to stop, I’m invisible, I’m not here. (lights a candle)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: But I don’t, hmm... (on phone) Oh, who approved that order?! (listens) Well there is no Mark Robbinson in this office. (to Sophie) Get me Mark on the phone!

dialogue.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: I love Mark. (to Ross) Do you know Mark?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, let me just check that with what I got here, all right see 038 is not the number for (Ross starts making a lot of noise with a handheld pepper grinder) this store, 038 is Atlanta. And I...(stops and looks at Ross)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (stopping grinding) Pepper?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (angrily) None for me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay sorry, whew.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I’m sorry, as I was saying the store number is wrong, and I’m sorry but that’s... (notices a fire that Ross’s candle has started) Oh my God!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (putting out the fire with a squeeze bottle of water) Okay, that’s a fire. Oh yeah. Oh yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on phone) Excuse me, I’m sorry, I’m gonna have to call you back, I’ve got a Schemp in my office. (hangs up) (to Ross) What are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I’m sorry. But ah, hey, oh, somebody’s off the phone, how ‘bout a glass of wine by the fire, I could get it going again.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross you’re not listening to me, I don’t have time to stop.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on Rach, you don’t have what, ten minutes?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don’t have ten minutes!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? (to Sophie) Sophie, does she have ten minutes?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey, Ross!!! I told you I don’t!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Don’t yell at me okay, this is the most I’ve seen you all week.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Look, I cannot do this right now, okay, I’ve got a deadline, would you just go home, I’ll talk to you later. (storms out)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, but wait...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Good bye!

dialogue.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Actually, that’s our three hole punch.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Rachel’s office, Rachel and a co-worker (Sophie) are dealing with the
crisis.]

events.event_description: Rachel is on the phone discussing a purchase order and demands to speak to a supervisor.
Ross enters Rachel's office carrying a basket and greets her.
Ross reveals he brought a picnic and pulls the cover off the basket.
Sophie comments on Ross bringing a picnic and jokes about starting to wear makeup.
Rachel informs Sophie that she has a crisis and is busy, ignoring Ross's picnic.
Ross starts making noise with a pepper grinder while Rachel is on the phone.
Rachel notices a fire caused by Ross's candle and reacts with alarm.
Ross attempts to put out the fire with a squeeze bottle of water.
Rachel tells Ross she doesn't have time to stop and ends the call, storming out of the office.
Ross tries to protest as Rachel leaves, and Sophie comments on the office's three-hole punch.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is eating the picnic as Rachel comes home from work.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi. Look um, about what happened earlier...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, hey, well, I-I completely understand. You were, you were stressed.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (throws her stuff down) I was gonna give you a chance to apologise to me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: For what? For letting you throw me out of your office?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You had no right coming down to my office Ross. You do not bring a picnic basket to somebody’s work! Unless maybe they were a park ranger!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, well excuse me for wanting to be with my girlfriend on our anniversary, boy what an ass am I.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: But I told you, I didn’t have the time!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, well you never have the time. I mean, I don’t feel like I even have a girlfriend anymore, Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wh, Ross what do you want from me? You want me, you want me to quit my job so you can feel like you have a girlfriend?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, but it’d be nice if you realised, it’s just a job!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Just a job!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross do you realise this is the first time in my life I’m doing something I actually care about. This is the first time in my life I’m doing something that I’m actually good at. I mean. if you don’t get that...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, hey, I get that, okay, I get that big time. And I’m happy for ya, but I’m tired of having a relationship with your answering machine! Okay, I don’t know what to do anymore.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well neither do I!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Is this about Mark?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (shocked) Oh my God.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, it’s not, it’s not.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my God. I cannot keep having this same fight over and over again, Ross, no, you’re, you’re, you’re making this too hard.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh I’m, I’m making this too hard. Okay, what do you want me to do.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don’t know, I don’t know. Urrrgh! Look, maybe we should take a break.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, fine, you’re right. Let’s ah, let’s take a break, (goes to the door) let’s cool off, okay, let’s get some frozen yogart, or something.. (opens the door)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. (Ross is standing in the doorway.) A break from us.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is eating the picnic as Rachel comes home from work.]

events.event_description: Rachel arrives home from work and enters the scene at Monica and Rachel's apartment.
Ross greets Rachel with a casual 'Hey' while eating a picnic.
Rachel confronts Ross about the earlier incident, indicating she wants to discuss it.
Ross acknowledges Rachel’s stress and suggests he understands her feelings.
Rachel throws her belongings down, expressing her expectation for Ross to apologize.
Ross sarcastically questions what he should apologize for, referencing being thrown out of Rachel's office.
Rachel criticizes Ross for bringing a picnic basket to her workplace, implying inappropriate behavior.
Ross defends his actions, expressing frustration about their relationship and feeling like he has no girlfriend.
Rachel defends her job, stating it is something she cares about and is good at, and criticizes Ross for not understanding this.
Ross suggests taking a break from their relationship to cool off, and Rachel agrees, indicating a separation.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Philly, Chandler and Joey are talking to Chloe.]

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: And the advances in collating in the past five years, I mean we just got in an X-5000, y'know. The X-5000 makes the X-50 look like a T-71.

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: (seeing Ross enter) Hey, it’s the dinosaur guy. (runs over to Ross) Hi, Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, hi Chloe.

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: I want you to met some friends of mine. (Introduces him to Chandler and Joey) This guy is my hero, he comes in with some stuff he wants it blown up 400%, we said we don’t do that, and he says you gotta. And y'know what, we did it. And now anytime anybody wants 400, we just say ‘let’s Ross it!’

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And that’s the only colour that comes in.

dialogue.speaker: ISSAC
dialogue.text: Yo, Chloe, do you have a quarter for the condom machine?

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Oh! (storms off)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, what are you doing here? I thought tonight was your big anniversary dinner.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, little change in plans. Ahh, we’re gonna break-up instead.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Philly, Chandler and Joey are talking to Chloe.]

events.event_description: Chloe introduces Ross to Chandler and Joey, describing a past project involving a 400% increase in explosive power and the phrase 'let's Ross it!'
Chloe sees Ross entering and runs over to greet him
Chloe asks Issac for a quarter for the condom machine
Chloe storms off after Issac asks for a quarter
Chandler questions Ross about his plans for the evening, referencing an anniversary dinner
Ross announces to Chandler that he and Rachel are going to break up instead of attending the anniversary dinner

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Restaurant, Monica and Phoebe are on their dates with Sergei and Mischa.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, and I can also speak a little French. Voulez-vous coucher avec moi ce soir? (Mischa laughs) Why? What did I say?

dialogue.speaker: MISCHA
dialogue.text: Well, you just asked if I wanted to go to bed with you tonight.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God! No wonder I get such great service at Cafe Maurice.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (laughing and banging her spoon on the table) Knock, knock, knock, knock, hi. Um, could you please tell Sergei that um, I was fascinated by what Boutros Boutros Gali said in the New York Times.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You didn’t say Boutros Boutros Gali.

dialogue.speaker: MISCHA
dialogue.text: (to Sergei) Boutros Boutros Gali.

dialogue.speaker: MISCHA
dialogue.text: He says he was too.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Interesting.

dialogue.speaker: MISCHA
dialogue.text: (to Monica) So I was wondering....

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, ah, before you get all talky again, umm, could you also please tell Sergei that I really like his suit.

dialogue.speaker: MISCHA
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe, very quickly) Eh, he said, thank you very much, he thinks you look very pretty tonight, your hair, golden like the sun. (to Monica) So you're a chef?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I’m also thinking about opening up my own restaurant.

dialogue.speaker: MISCHA
dialogue.text: Oh, really.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Monica, can I talk to you behind my menu, please. (Behind the menu) What are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, I was having a conversation.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah but, Mischa is so interested in you, that Sergei and I haven’t been able to say two words to each other.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What do you want me to do? Just sit here silently while you three have a conversation?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That would be great. Thank you.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Restaurant, Monica and Phoebe are on their dates with Sergei and Mischa.]

events.event_description: Monica speaks French phrase to Mischa, asking if he wants to go to bed with her.
Mischa interprets Monica's French phrase as an invitation to bed.
Phoebe asks Sergei to tell him she was interested in what Boutros Boutros Gali said in the New York Times.
Mischa relays to Sergei that he was also interested in Boutros Boutros Gali.
Mischa quickly tells Sergei that he said Phoebe looks pretty tonight and compliments her hair.
Mischa asks Sergei if he is a chef.
Monica considers having a conversation with Phoebe behind her menu.
Phoebe questions Monica about her behavior, implying she is ignoring Mischa's interest.
Phoebe requests Monica to sit silently while she and others converse with Mischa and Sergei.
Monica agrees to sit silently as Phoebe requests.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is lying in front of the bay window, and the phone
rings.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (jumping up to answer the phone) Hello!

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Oh, hi. It’s Mark.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (disappointed) Oh.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: What? Is it my breath?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No! Sorry, I just thought you were somebody else. Hi!

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Hi. Well, look, I was just gonna leave a message, isn’t tonight your, your big anniversary dinner?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah. Well, umm.....

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Rach, are you okay?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on the verge of tears) Yeah, I’m fine.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: You wanna talk, I mean I can come over?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No! Really, no, please, please, that’s, that’s okay.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: All right, all right, I’m coming over, and I’m bringing Chinese food.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, I’m not, I’m not hungry.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: It’s for me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh. Okay, bye.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is lying in front of the bay window, and the phone
rings.]

events.event_description: Rachel answers the phone after it rings, greeting Mark.
Mark initiates a conversation by greeting Rachel and mentioning he was going to leave a message.
Rachel responds with disappointment, indicating she thought Mark was someone else.
Mark asks Rachel if she is okay, expressing concern.
Rachel states she is fine, on the verge of tears, and does not want to talk.
Mark offers to come over and bring Chinese food.
Rachel declines the offer, saying she is not hungry.
Mark insists he is coming over and will bring Chinese food.
Rachel agrees reluctantly and ends the call.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So what are you gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What can I do? One person wants to break-up, you break-up.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, no way! Come on, this is you guys, call her and work it out.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh come on, we just had this huge fight, all right, don’t I have to wait a while?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, this isn’t like swimming after you eat, pick up the phone!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know that whole swimming thing is a myth.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, tell that to my Uncle Lenny.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Why? What happened to him?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Nothing, he’s just really believes in that.

events.event_description: Ross expresses frustration about the breakup situation, implying he feels powerless to change it.
Chandler encourages Ross to call his ex-girlfriend and work things out.
Ross questions whether he should wait after a recent fight before calling his ex.
Chandler dismisses the idea that waiting is necessary, comparing it to swimming after eating.
Chandler clarifies that the myth about swimming after eating is false.
Joey comments that his Uncle Lenny believes in the myth about swimming after eating.
Chandler asks Joey what happened to his Uncle Lenny.
Joey responds that nothing happened to his Uncle Lenny; he just believes in the myth.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Mark is there, opening Chinese food boxes.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, and then, we got into this big, stupid fight. I just, it was awful. I told him he treats me like a park ranger, or something, oh and then I told him I wanted to take a break, I don’t want to take a break.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Wow. I’m sorry. Eggroll?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. (grabs an eggroll) And then I called him, and he wasn’t there.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Well, then he’s, he’s probably just, out.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, thank you that’s very helpful, I’m glad you came over.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hello.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi! It’s me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi! Oh, I’m so glad you called.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Really? I’ve been thinking, this is crazy, I mean don’t, don’t you think we can work on this?

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Hey, what do you want to drink?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Who’s that?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Nobody.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Is it okay if I finish the apple juice?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Is that Mark?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Umm, honey, look he just came over to....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah! Got it! (slams the phone down, and walks back to the bar.)

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Hey, dinosaur guy, look at you, so sad. Come dance.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah, that’s okay, thanks.

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Hey, you don’t have to smile. You just have to dance.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, I don’t feel like dancing, I feel like having a drink. Okay?

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Oh, okay. (to the bartender) Hey, two beers. (sits down next to him)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Mark is there, opening Chinese food boxes.]

events.event_description: Rachel describes to Mark that she and her boyfriend had a big fight and she told him she wanted to take a break.
Mark offers Rachel an eggroll and asks if she wants to eat it.
Rachel calls her boyfriend and finds out he is not available.
Ross enters the scene and greets Rachel.
Rachel expresses happiness that Ross called and suggests they work on their issues.
Mark asks Ross what he wants to drink.
Ross questions who is on the phone, suspecting it is someone else.
Rachel dismisses Ross's suspicion and says nobody is on the phone.
Ross slams the phone down and walks back to the bar after realizing Mark is on the phone.
Chloe approaches Ross and invites him to dance, noticing he looks sad.

dialogue.speaker: MISCHA
dialogue.text: (to Monica) And the vet said it was time. And so from half a world away, while my Mother held the phone to his ear, I said good bye to my dog,. In seven languages.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh. (to Phoebe) Can I have a tissue?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, sure. I just hope you, hope you don’t accidentally suck it up through your nose and choke on it.

dialogue.speaker: MISCHA
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) Sergei, would like to apologise for my behaviour tonight.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, tell him, apology accepted.

dialogue.speaker: MISCHA
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Oh, he’s unbelievable. I mean for the first time in three years somebody wants to actually want to talk to me, but do you think he would let me enjoy that, no!! (to Sergei) You silly diplomat, why don’t you learn some English, Sergei?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Excuse me, but umm, isn’t he paying for your dinner?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, the man’s dog just died.

dialogue.speaker: MISCHA
dialogue.text: (to Monica) I have just resigned my post. Would you care to accompany me to the Rainbow Room? I have diplomatic coupons.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It will be my pleasure. (to Phoebe) My guy has diplomatic coupons. Your guy can’t even say coupons. (they leave)

dialogue.speaker: SERGEI
dialogue.text: Uh, (picks up a plate) plate?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Plate! Yes, plate.

dialogue.speaker: SERGEI
dialogue.text: Plate. Plate. Plate.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: See, we don’t need them.

dialogue.speaker: SERGEI
dialogue.text: (picking up a cup) Plate?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah.

events.event_description: Mischa tells Monica that the vet said it was time to say goodbye to his dog, and he did so in seven languages while his mother held the phone to the dog's ear.
Monica asks Phoebe for a tissue.
Phoebe responds to Monica, joking about the possibility of Monica choking on the tissue.
Mischa apologizes to Sergei for his behavior during the evening.
Phoebe accepts Sergei's apology on behalf of Mischa.
Mischa criticizes Sergei for not learning English and comments on Sergei's unwillingness to let him enjoy talking to Monica.
Monica comments on Sergei paying for dinner and mentions the dog's death, then invites Mischa to the Rainbow Room using diplomatic coupons.
Monica and Mischa leave the scene to go to the Rainbow Room.
Sergei picks up a plate and asks if it is a plate.
Phoebe confirms to Sergei that the object he picked up is a plate, and Sergei repeats the word 'plate' multiple times.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Philly, With or Without You is playing. (Which is the same song Ross
played for Rachel in TOW the List.)]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Chloe) I like this song.

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Well, you’re practically dancing already. Why don’t you just do it over here?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, no, no.

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: What? Are you married? ‘Cause that’s okay.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: The Philly, With or Without You is playing. (Which is the same song Ross
played for Rachel in TOW the List.)]

events.event_description: Ross comments to Chloe that he likes the song playing.
Chloe suggests that Ross should dance over to her.
Ross declines Chloe's invitation to dance.
Chloe questions Ross about his marital status.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is next to the bay window again, Mark has left.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (picks up the phone and calls Ross) Oh, be home, be home, be home, be home, be home, be home. Be home. Be home, be home, be home. Oh, you’re not home.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is next to the bay window again, Mark has left.]

events.event_description: Rachel picks up the phone and dials Ross's number.
Rachel repeatedly says 'be home' into the phone, expressing her desire for Ross to be home.
Rachel realizes Ross is not home after the call.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Philly, Ross is dancing with Chloe.]

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Still no smile?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Philly, Ross is dancing with Chloe.]

events.event_description: Ross begins dancing with Chloe at The Philly.
Chloe notices Ross's lack of a smile while dancing.
Chloe asks Ross if he is still without a smile.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Sergei is teaching Phoebe how to sing American Pie , by Don
Maclean.]

dialogue.speaker: SERGEI
dialogue.text: (singing) Touchet, touchet, Miss Americccan pie. (stops to correct Phoebe) Ameri-ccan.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ameri-can.

dialogue.speaker: SERGEI
dialogue.text: Ameri-ccan.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ameri-can. Y'know it’s a very hard language. Let’s do it again.

dialogue.speaker: SERGEI
dialogue.text: (to the rest of Central Perk) Everybody!! (In his language, and continues.)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Sergei is teaching Phoebe how to sing American Pie , by Don
Maclean.]

events.event_description: Sergei begins singing 'American Pie' with a mispronunciation of 'Touchet'
Sergei stops singing to correct Phoebe's pronunciation of 'American'
Phoebe repeats the word 'American' to practice pronunciation
Sergei corrects Phoebe's pronunciation of 'American'
Phoebe acknowledges the difficulty of the pronunciation and suggests doing it again
Sergei addresses the rest of Central Perk to sing along in his language
